description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8gu1d","text":"This protocol is created to help efficiently produce high-throughput plates with different reagents using either a single or multi-channel pipette controlled by an Opentrons OT-2 robot. By running this script, users can achieve a precise layout of reagents in specified volumes across the final plate(s) using a single-channel or multi-channel pipette based on a customizable Excel input file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"erm3u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3unhi","text":"The protocol uses a Python script for the Opentrons OT-2 robot in conjunction with an Excel file that contains all the necessary parameters and will be processed by the Python script.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81p44","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5sd","text":"This Excel file contains customizable variables such as the number of final plates, transfer volumes, plate types, and the type of pipette used.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2872l","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qb1m","text":"This method ensures the accurate distribution of reagents based on user-defined configurations, making the high-throughput process more efficient.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59vee","text":"This protocol has been used in our laboratory to check how different quorum sensing systems work in P. putida KT2440.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":117},{"style":"italic","offset":100,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dg803","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fl5gi","text":"This protocol is a set of instructions or description of the LAP repository entry LAP-CustomReagentMixingMultiSinglePip-OT2-1.0.0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":82,"length":47}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":61,"length":14}],"data":{}},{"key":"88ekj","text":"You can find the script and complementary information for this specific version of the protocol in this LAP entry link and GitHub Link to LAP entry documents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":104,"length":14},{"key":2,"offset":123,"length":34}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5419C7D84E5911EF810E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"http://www.laprepo.com"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5419C7D84E5911EF810E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.laprepo.com/protocol/custom-mixing-single-multi-channel-pipette/"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5419C7D84E5911EF810E0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://github.com/BiocomputationLab/LAPrepository/tree/main/LAPEntries/LAP-CustomReagentMixingMultiSinglePip-OT2-1.0.0"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"b92v","text":"This protocol was developed using Python 3.7.1, OT App Software Version 7.0.2, and API level version 2.14 on a Linux 4.14.74 system (these are the OT-2 specifications).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46p9f","text":"In the script, several packages are used:  pandas (0.25.3), openpyxl (3.1.2), math, random and numpy (1.15.1)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3q6um","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8u5gp","text":"It has been tested with cultures from Pseudomonas putida KT2440 as part of testing quorum sensing systems with different concentrations of 3mBz to control the systems programmed in them.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":38,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7meoj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85gam","text":"The maximum number of 96-well plates per run is 9 final plates with no replicas, replacing the tiprack, using only a single-channel pipette and one falcon tube rack necessary to distribute the reagents to all the final plates. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"165q8","text":"We want to create three plates: 1 with a single-channel pipette and 2 with a multi-channel pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":99}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hs46","text":"The two plates filled with the multi-channel will have different concentrations of IPTG and certain bacteria. At the same time, the single-channel pipette will create a plate with varying combinations of reagents.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":213}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2cqv0","text":"The multi-channel reservoir source's optimization will be low, and the reservoir will have 15 columns and 1 row.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":112}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fu6p6","text":"The tip will be changed every time a reagent is changed, and the liquids will be dispensed at the top so the source reagents are not contaminated. {"blocks":[{"key":"6l1ba","text":"Select Robot to Perform Script","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3m3cb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a3avr","text":"Click in the protocol -\u003e Start setup -\u003e Choose the OT where the file VariablesCustomMixing.xlsx is -\u003e Proceed To Setto overpour to account for any pipetting errors slightlyup","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":116},{"style":"bold","offset":172,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ioap","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3ssh5","text":"After clicking on Proceed to Setup, you should obtain the labware's positions in the Labware tab and in the Liquids tab, the reagents and their corresponding volume.\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":85,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":108,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"79jq5","text":"If the protocol with the set variables cannot run, an error will occur during the simulation's run in the app after Start setup. Many errors are already contemplated and have a specific message that hints tothe user what could have gone wrong.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":115,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d2fml","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8bard","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ctrmr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1731q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"75c0p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":69,"offset":143,"style":"bold"}],"key":"2a4l0","text":"The reagent volumes in the reservoirs for the multi-channel pipettes or tubes for the single-channel pipettes are precisely measured, so it is recommended to overpour slightly to account for any pipetting errors.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":60,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"eeq4i","text":"It is recommended that you perform a labware position check.\n","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dbi8j","text":"You can do it with test plates after loading the script but before cleaning the surface to prepare the experiment layout. That way, you reduce the probability of contamination (using the test plates and labware) and pipetting errors (position check).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5icd3","text":"Make sure the needed calibrations are done","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4rjg4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajptg","text":"Pipettes, tip racks and tip length calibrations need to be done for the items used in this run","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
